TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

The applicant was a refugee from GPE who fled to GPE in DATE . In accordance with a number of governmental decisions , the applicant – together with other refugees DATE was placed in a flat in a building previously owned by ORG and used as the ORG ’s graduate school .

On an unspecified date , the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG ( PERSON քաղաքապետարան ) seeking to obtain title to the above flat . She claimed that the flat was ownerless and that she had bona fide , manifestly and continuously been in possession of the flat for DATE , which entitled her to acquire ownership of it in accordance with LAW . ORG for ORG ( ՀՀ կառավարությանն առընթեր պետական գույքի կառավարման վարչություն ) was also joined as a defendant .

On DATE the GPE and ORG of GPE ( Երևան քաղաքի Կենտրոն և Նորք-Մարաշ համայնքների առաջին ատյանի դատարան ) granted the applicant ’s claim . No appeal was lodged , so this judgment became final and enforceable on CARDINAL May CARDINAL .
On DATE the applicant ’s title was formally registered and the relevant ownership certificate was provided to her .

On an unspecified date , the Deputy General Prosecutor ( ՀՀ գլխավոր դատախազի տեղակալ ) lodged a cassation appeal on points of law against this judgment with ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) , in accordance with LAW .

On DATE ORG granted the appeal and quashed the judgment of DATE . ORG found that the flat in question , in accordance with the decision of ORG of GPE of DATE and ORG , was in ORG ownership and , therefore , the applicant was not entitled to acquire ownership under LAW . The case was remitted to ORG ( ORG քաղաքացիական գործերով վերաքննիչ դատարան ) for a new examination .

On DATE ORG examined the applicant ’s claim anew . The applicant and the CARDINAL defendants , namely ORG and ORG for ORG , made their submissions . Having heard the parties , ORG decided to dismiss the applicant ’s claim on the ground that she had failed to provide evidence of bona fide , manifest and continuous possession of the flat in question .
The applicant lodged a cassation appeal on points of law and procedure .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s cassation appeal on the ground that the flat in question was in ORG ownership and was in the possession of the applicant not as her own property but as a temporary place of residence .

According to LAW , public authorities are entitled to institute court proceedings seeking to defend the pecuniary interests of the ORG . The public authority which has instituted proceedings enjoys all the rights of a plaintiff and bears his responsibilities . If the relevant public authority does not institute proceedings , the proceedings seeking to defend the pecuniary interests of the ORG shall be instituted by the public prosecutor in accordance with the PERSON on ORG .

According to LAW , judgments of first instance courts enter into force DATE after their delivery . According to LAW , appeals against judgments of first instance courts which have not entered into force can be brought by the parties and persons who were not parties to the proceedings but whose rights and obligations were affected by the judgment . According to ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL , such appeals can be brought within DATE after the delivery of the judgment of the first instance court and are examined by ORG .

According to LAW , judgments of ORG enter into force DATE after their delivery . According to LAW , appeals against judgments of ORG which have not entered into force can be brought by the parties and persons who were not parties to the proceedings but whose rights and obligations were affected by the judgment .

According to LAW , judgments of first instance courts and ORG which have entered into force can be reviewed through cassation proceedings . According to LAW , appeals against judgments of first instance courts and ORG which have entered into force may be brought by ( CARDINAL ) ORG of GPE and his deputies in cases prescribed by LAW and in accordance with the PERSON on ORG ; and ( CARDINAL ) advocates holding a special licence and registered with ORG .
According to Article CARDINAL , cassation appeals shall be examined by ORG of ORG .

According to LAW , a cassation appeal can be lodged on ( CARDINAL ) points of law or a procedural violation of the parties’ rights ; or ( CARDINAL ) on the ground of newly discovered circumstances . A cassation appeal on the ground envisaged by the first paragraph of this Article can be lodged within DATE from the date of entry into force of the judgment .

According to Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL , ORG shall review the judgments on the basis of the grounds presented in the appeal . The ORG can either dismiss the appeal , or otherwise quash the whole or part of the judgment and remit the case for a new examination by ORG .

According to Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL , ORG shall adopt a decision . ORG is not entitled to establish or consider as proven circumstances which have not been established by the contested judgment or have been rejected by it , to determine whether or not this or that piece of evidence is trustworthy , to resolve the issue of CARDINAL piece of evidence having more weight than another or the issue of which norm of substantive law must be applied and what kind of judgment must be adopted upon the new examination of the case .

According to LAW , the decision of ORG enters into force from the moment of its delivery and is not subject to appeal . According to LAW , a copy of this decision shall be sent to the appellant , to the parties and to the relevant court within DATE from its adoption .

According to LAW , where a violation of pecuniary interests of the ORG has been disclosed , the public prosecutor or , upon his instruction , the relevant public authority or public official shall institute court proceedings .

According to LAW , ORG can lodge appeals against court judgments and decisions according to the relevant rules of criminal and civil procedure . Such appeals can be also lodged by the subordinate prosecutors within the limits of their competence . The public prosecutor is entitled to ask the court for the case file of any case in which a final judgment or a decision has been taken . The public prosecutor , if he considers the court judgment or decision to be unlawful or unsubstantiated , shall lodge an appeal with the superior court .

According to LAW , a property is considered ownerless if it has no owner or its owner is unknown or has renounced his ownership in respect of that property . Ownership of an ownerless immovable property can be obtained by virtue of adverse possession ( LAW .

According to LAW , a citizen or a legal person , who is not the owner of an immovable property but has bona fide , manifestly and continuously possessed it as his own property for a period of DATE , shall obtain ownership in respect of that property ( adverse possession ) .
